The submitted offer must include all assortment items.<br> Justification:<br> 1. Technical and functional considerations: The subject of the order is an integrated and comprehensive whole intended to equip the rehabilitation department. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: DOMANIEWICE COMMUNE. Summary: Collection and Management of Unsegregated (Mixed) Municipal Waste Along with its Selective Collection from the Domaniewice Commune in 2026. Description: 1. The subject of the order is to provide a service consisting of:<br> 1) collection directly from real estate and management of municipal waste collected selectively and non-selectively, generated by owners of residential real estate (households), in a way that ensures achieving appropriate levels of recycling, preparation for reuse and recovery by other methods by the Commune and reducing the mass of biodegradable waste sent to landfills,<br> 2) providing containers, containers and bags for selective waste collection,<br> 3) receiving and management of municipal waste - waste from the Selective Municipal Waste Collection Point run by the Commune,<br> 4) collecting and transporting municipal waste to the place of waste management from residential properties (households) and from the Selective Collection Point Municipal Waste run by the Commune.<br> 2. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex No. 1 to the SWZ and Chapter 4 of the SWZ.<br> 3. Due to the difficult to predict amount of waste that will be generated during the execution of the order, the estimated amounts specified in the SWZ do not have to be correspond to the size and characteristics of the waste stream actually collected and managed by the Contractor during the execution of the order. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PROVINCIAL HOSPITAL CENTER OF THE JELENIA GORA VALLEY. Summary: Delivery and Launch of Solutions Enabling Physical Segmentation of Servers and Edge Devices. Description: The subject of the order is the delivery and launch of solutions enabling the physical segmentation of servers for the Provincial Hospital Center of the Jelenia Gora Valley in Jelenia Gora, in accordance with Annex No. 1 to the SWZ - Description of the Subject of the Order. The subject of the order includes design together with the installation, delivery and commissioning of solutions enabling the physical segmentation of servers and edge devices in order to increase the security and efficiency of the network and server infrastructure. The designed solution is intended to provide physical segmentation allowing for isolation critical IT resources, which minimizes the risk of spreading potential cyber threats and limits unauthorized users' access to sensitive data. In order to implement the physical segmentation of servers and edge devices, the Ordering Party allows the preparation of a second one server room in a container building. The final date for completion of deliveries and order fulfillment cannot be later than May 15, 2026.<br> Delivery and launch of solutions enabling physical segmentation of servers<br> and edge devices<br> Doc Title: Delivery and launch of enabling solutions physical segmentation of servers and edge devices<br> Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: 1. DEFINITION OF THE SUBJECT OF THE ORDER:<br> The subject of the order is the supply of mobile blood collection points based on buses - brand new, unused, complete, fully operational, manufactured no earlier than in 2025, coming from the official distribution channel on within Poland or the European Union, unencumbered by any third party rights. The vehicle cannot be displayed at sales points.<br> 1.2. The Ordering Party will consider that a brand new vehicle will also be a vehicle which, due to the need for specialized bodywork, appropriate technical inspections, obtaining appropriate approvals and transport to the Ordering Party will have a mileage of no more than 4,000 kilometers. The Ordering Party allows the delivery of the subject of the order to the Ordering Party under its own power, on wheels, without the use of trailers. The ordering party requires submitting by the Contractor, on the day of handing over the vehicle with a mileage of over 50 km, a statement which will indicate the mileage of the vehicle delivered to the Ordering Party, i.e. the Contractor is obliged to indicate the route that was covered by the vehicle delivered to the Ordering Party which is the subject of order along with an indication of the distance in km in connection with the implementation of the subject of the order.<br> 1.3. Description of the subject of the order - the required parameters are specified in Annex No. 2a (RCKiK Bydgoszcz), 2b (RCKiK Katowice), 2c (RCKiK Poznań), 2d (RCKiK Warszawa), 2e (RCKiK Słupsk) to the SWZ, depending for what part.... This task involves the reception, management and transport of municipal waste collected selectively and non-selectively from real estate where residents of the commune live, real estate used for recreational and leisure purposes located in the commune of Leoncin, Municipal Waste Selective Collection Point conducted by the Commune, in a way that ensures that the Commune achieves appropriate levels of recycling, preparation for reuse and recovery by other methods, and limiting the mass of biodegradable waste sent to landfills.<br> Doc Title: "Waste collection and management municipal from property owners in the Leoncin commune and equipment with containers, collection and management of waste from the commune. PSZOK in 2026<br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The fuels must meet the requirements specified in the Regulation of the Minister of Climate of June 26, 2024 on quality requirements for liquid fuels (Journal of Laws of 2024, item 1018, as amended) and the standards specified in: - PN EN 590 for diesel oil, - PN EN 228 for unleaded gasoline 95, - PN EN 589 for liquefied LPG gas, or equivalent, and in the case of changes to these standards during the term of the contract - parameters according to new standards or relevant equivalent standards. The tank must have an appropriate certificate. The Contractor will successively deliver fuel to the non-pressure tank rented to the Ordering Party and to the tank owned by the Ordering Party with a capacity of 2,500 liters, which will be placed at the landfill in Wysieka. The Ordering Party also requires the possibility of refueling vehicles at a station indicated by the Contractor located in the town of Bartoszyce or at a distance of no more than 10 km from the Ordering Party's headquarters. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: CITY OF POZNAŃ POZNAŃ SPORTS AND RECREATION CENTERS LOCAL GOVERNMENT BUDGET DEPARTMENT. Summary: Purchase of Light Fuel Oil for the Golęcin Branch in Poznań, Ul. Warmińska 1.. Description: Purchase of light fuel oil for the Golcin Branch, ul. Warmiska 1, Poznań. The subject of the order includes the purchase, transport to the destination and unloading of the oil. Fuel oil should meet quality parameters in accordance with Standard PN C-96024: 2020-12 (or equivalent). The delivered oil should have a certificate quality - issued by an entity authorized to control quality, confirming the quality parameters of the offered light fuel oil - provided with each delivery. The contractor is obliged to deliver fuel oil using vehicles - road tankers - in accordance with the requirements of the Act of August 19 2011 on the transport of dangerous goods and the terms of ADR (European Agreement concerning the international carriage of dangerous goods by road, concluded in Geneva on September 30, 1957, Journal of Laws of 1975, No. 35, item 189, as amended), equipped with filler nozzles with a legalized measuring device (unit 1 liter), road tankers must be equipped with pump and printer dispensing devices indicating the exact amount of oil dispensed at a temperature of +150C (the devices must have legalization certificates from the Office of Weights and Measures ). Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: 1) The subject of the order is the modernization of the Rumia-Reda border ditch, replacing the ditch with a bed made of L-type elements on the section from ul. Grunwaldzka to ul. Kosynierw in Rumia.2) The investment aims to change the open drainage ditch L3-14 into an open riverbed made of L-type concrete elements from the inlet at the street Grunwaldzka to the inlet to the culvert under Kosynierw Street in Rumia with a two-chamber sand trap at the outlet of the river bed to the existing ditch under Kosynierw Street and cleaning works consisting in cutting down colliding low vegetation. The rebuilt section of the ditch will have an increased retention volume and capacity will be to allow for significantly increased vegetation coverage, which will translate into the purification of waters flowing through it and also increase its retention. This will result in an extension of the time and path of water circulation in the environment of the given catchment area, which will directly translate into an improvement in its water balance. The project is intended to aiming to create an effective rainwater management system in the Rumia Municipality. Description: The subject of the order is the "Purchase of two new zero-emission electric buses for the needs of the inhabitants of Puck County."<br> The order is financed from the funds of the Municipalities and the District and co-financing from EU funds from the National Reconstruction and Resilience Plan, component E Green, intelligent mobility, Investment: E1.1.2 Zero- and low-emission public transport (buses) 2.0<br> The subject of the order is the delivery of 2 pieces of the same, brand new, zero-emission electric buses of class II, category M3. The buses in question must be factory-built new, unused, fully functional, manufactured no earlier than 2025, coming from an official distribution channel in Poland or the European Union, not encumbered with any third-party rights. Buses cannot be displayed at sales points. They must be of the same model/type, the same version, have the same equipment and organization of the passenger space. The components, parts used, solutions and technical parameters must be the same in all buses delivered. The buses are to be delivered with additional equipment, authorization granted, necessary software, documentation and training. The ordering party will consider that a brand new vehicle will also be a vehicle which, due to the need to perform appropriate technical inspections, obtain appropriate approvals and transport to the ordering party, will have ....
